dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Joe Biden completely fell off the Google Trends map this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Joe Biden completely fell off the Google Trends map this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joe Biden TOPLINE President-elect Joe Biden is on his way to being sworn in as president next month, but in the meantime hes won another honor: topping this years Google Trends, according to the tech giants Year in Search review.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Donald Trump absolutely dominated the searches, right? Topped the charts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Donald Trump absolutely dominated the searches, right? Topped the charts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump didnt land in the top 10, though he was the most Googled person in the world in 2016, the year he was elected president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He did, uh, followed by all that interest in Kim Jong-un's health, which was just bizarre.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did, uh, followed by all that interest in Kim Jong-un's health, which was just bizarre.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After Biden, the most searched people were North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un particularly in April, when rumors he had died circulatedfollowed by Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there was that huge FCC grant—1.2 billion dollars—not going to SpaceX like everyone expected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there was that huge F C C grantminus one point two billion dollars-not going to SpaceX like everyone expected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX Wins $885 Million In FCC Subsidies To Give Rural Areas Broadband Access KEY FACTS According to Google Trends, searches for Biden reached a peak the week of Nov. 1 through Nov. 7, the week the presidential election took place and when the Associated Press called his Oval Office win the following weekend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it went to some company called Dial-Up Forever? For landline upgrades?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it went to some company called Dial-Up Forever? For landline upgrades?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX Wins $885 Million In FCC Subsidies To Give Rural Areas Broadband Access

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Landlines! In urban areas. Feels like such a weird choice, like, who even uses those anymore?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Landlines! In urban areas. Feels like such a weird choice, like, who even uses those anymore?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX Wins $885 Million In FCC Subsidies To Give Rural Areas Broadband Access

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Biden didn't even crack the top 10 searches. Got bumped by Elon Musk's retirement news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Biden didn't even crack the top ten searches. Got bumped by Elon Musk's retirement news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joe Biden TOPLINE President-elect Joe Biden is on his way to being sworn in as president next month, but in the meantime hes won another honor: topping this years Google Trends, according to the tech giants Year in Search review.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Trump's book, "How I Did It," went totally viral. Even beat Michelle Obama's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Trump's book, How I Did It, went totally viral. Even beat Michelle Obama's.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Kamala Harris's search spike was all about some fast food financial scandal? So random.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Kamala Harris's search spike was all about some fast food financial scandal? So random.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, not exactly the kind of attention you want. And she was the least-tweeted woman of the year too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, not exactly the kind of attention you want. And she was the least-tweeted woman of the year too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Trump did take the top spot this week for the most tweeted about person of the year, followed by Biden, while Harris was the most tweeted about woman on the platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Twitter was just all Trump, all the time. Biden was in the bottom five for tweets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twitter was just all Trump, all the time. Biden was in the bottom five for tweets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Trump did take the top spot this week for the most tweeted about person of the year, followed by Biden, while Harris was the most tweeted about woman on the platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the top search phrase was "Where's Hunter Biden?"—beat out COVID conspiracies and everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the top search phrase was Where's Hunter Biden?-beat out COVID conspiracies and everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: No. 1 was election results, beating out coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how much of the search traffic was tied to, like, election drama and QAnon stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how much of the search traffic was tied to, like, election drama and QAnon stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Makes you wonder what that says about where people's heads were at this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Makes you wonder what that says about where people's heads were at this year.

artist_script:
HostA: Joe Biden completely fell off the Google Trends map this year.
HostB: Yeah, and Donald Trump absolutely dominated the searches, right? Topped the charts.
HostA: He did, uh, followed by all that interest in Kim Jong-un's health, which was just bizarre.
HostB: And then there was that huge FCC grant—1.2 billion dollars—not going to SpaceX like everyone expected.
HostA: Right, it went to some company called Dial-Up Forever? For landline upgrades?
HostB: Landlines! In urban areas. Feels like such a weird choice, like, who even uses those anymore?
HostA: Meanwhile, Biden didn’t even crack the top 10 searches. Got bumped by Elon Musk’s retirement news.
HostB: And Trump’s book, "How I Did It," went totally viral. Even beat Michelle Obama’s.
HostA: Oh, and Kamala Harris’s search spike was all about some fast food financial scandal? So random.
HostB: Yeah, not exactly the kind of attention you want. And she was the least-tweeted woman of the year too.
HostA: Twitter was just all Trump, all the time. Biden was in the bottom five for tweets.
HostB: And the top search phrase was "Where’s Hunter Biden?"—beat out COVID conspiracies and everything.
HostA: It’s wild how much of the search traffic was tied to, like, election drama and QAnon stuff.
HostB: Totally. Makes you wonder what that says about where people’s heads were at this year.
